allable","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"callable","type":"bool"},{"internalType":"bool","name":"removeReportingValidator","type":"bool"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"name":"reportingCounter","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"name":"reportingCounterTotal","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_miningAddress","type":"address"},{"internalType":"address","name":"_stakingAddress","type":"address"}],"name":"setStakingAddress","outputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"name":"stakingByMiningAddress","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[],"name":"stakingContract","outputs":[{"internalType":"contract IStakingHbbft","name":"","type":"address"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"name":"validatorAvailableSince","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"name":"validatorCounter","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"name":"validatorLastSuccess","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"details":"Stores the current validator set and contains the logic for choosing new validators before each staking epoch. The logic uses a random seed generated and stored by the `RandomHbbft` contract.","methods":{"announceAvailability()":{"details":"called by validators when a validator comes online after getting marked as unavailable caused by a failed key generation."},"areDelegatorsBanned(address)":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether delegators of the specified pool are currently banned. A validator pool can be banned when they misbehave (see the `_removeMaliciousValidator` function).","params":{"_miningAddress":"The mining address of the pool."}},"finalizeChange()":{"details":"Called by the system when a pending validator set is ready to be activated. Only valid when msg.sender == SUPER_USER (EIP96, 2**160 - 2). After this function is called, the `getValidators` getter returns the new validator set. If this function finalizes a new validator set formed by the `newValidatorSet` function, an old validator set is also stored and can be read by the `getPreviousValidators` getter."},"getCurrentTimestamp()":{"details":"Returns the current timestamp."},"getPendingValidators()":{"details":"Returns the current array of pending validators i.e. waiting to be activated in the new epoch The pending array is changed when a validator is removed as malicious or the validator set is updated by the `newValidatorSet` function."},"getPreviousValidators()":{"details":"Returns the previous validator set (validators' mining addresses array). The array is stored by the `finalizeChange` function when a new staking epoch's validator set is finalized."},"getValidators()":{"details":"Returns the current validator set (an array of mining addresses) which always matches the validator set kept in validator's node."},"initialize(address,address,address,address,address[],address[])":{"details":"Initializes the network parameters. Used by the constructor of the `InitializerHbbft` contract.","params":{"_blockRewardContract":"The address of the `BlockRewardHbbft` contract.","_initialMiningAddresses":"The array of initial validators' mining addresses.","_initialStakingAddresses":"The array of initial validators' staking addresses.","_keyGenHistoryContract":"The address of the `KeyGenHistory` contract.","_randomContract":"The address of the `RandomHbbft` contract.","_stakingContract":"The address of the `StakingHbbft` contract."}},"isInitialized()":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating if the `initialize` function has been called."},"isPendingValidator(address)":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified mining address is a pending validator. Used by the `isValidatorOrPending` and `KeyGenHistory.writeAck/Part` functions.","params":{"_miningAddress":"The mining address."}},"isReportValidatorValid(address)":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified validator (mining address) is able to call the `reportMalicious` function or whether the specified validator (mining address) can be reported as malicious. This function also allows a validator to call the `reportMalicious` function several blocks after ceasing to be a validator. This is possible if a validator did not have the opportunity to call the `reportMalicious` function prior to the engine calling the `finalizeChange` function.","params":{"_miningAddress":"The validator's mining address."}},"isValidatorBanned(address)":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified mining address is currently banned. A validator can be banned when they misbehave (see the `_removeMaliciousValidator` internal function).","params":{"_miningAddress":"The mining address."}},"isValidatorOrPending(address)":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified mining address is a validator or is in the `_pendingValidators`. Used by the `StakingHbbft.maxWithdrawAllowed` and `StakingHbbft.maxWithdrawOrderAllowed` getters.","params":{"_miningAddress":"The mining address."}},"maliceReportedForBlock(address,uint256)":{"details":"Returns an array of the validators (their mining addresses) which reported that the specified malicious validator misbehaved at the specified block.","params":{"_blockNumber":"The block number.","_miningAddress":"The mining address of malicious validator."}},"newValidatorSet()":{"details":"Implements the logic which forms a new validator set. If the number of active pools is greater than MAX_VALIDATORS, the logic chooses the validators randomly using a random seed generated and stored by the `RandomHbbft` contract. Automatically called by the `BlockRewardHbbft.reward` function at the latest block of the staking epoch."},"removeMaliciousValidators(address[])":{"details":"Removes malicious validators. Called by the the Hbbft engine when a validator has been inactive for a long period.","params":{"_miningAddresses":"The mining addresses of the malicious validators."}},"reportMalicious(address,uint256)":{"details":"Reports that the malicious validator misbehaved at the specified block. Called by the node of each honest validator after the specified validator misbehaved. See https://wiki.parity.io/Validator-Set.html#reporting-contract Can only be called when the `reportMaliciousCallable` getter returns `true`.","params":{"_blockNumber":"The block number where the misbehavior was observed.","_maliciousMiningAddress":"The mining address of the malicious validator."}},"reportMaliciousCallable(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Returns whether the `reportMalicious` function can be called by the specified validator with the given parameters. Used by the `reportMalicious` function and `TxPermission` contract. Also, returns a boolean flag indicating whether the reporting validator should be removed as malicious due to excessive reporting during the current staking epoch.","params":{"_blockNumber":"The block number which is passed to the `reportMalicious` function.","_maliciousMiningAddress":"The mining address of the malicious validator which is passed to the `reportMalicious` function.","_reportingMiningAddress":"The mining address of the reporting validator which is calling the `reportMalicious` function."},"return":"`bool callable` - The boolean flag indicating whether the `reportMalicious` function can be called at the moment. `bool removeReportingValidator` - The boolean flag indicating whether the reporting validator should be removed as malicious due to excessive reporting. This flag is only used by the `reportMalicious` function."},"setStakingAddress(address,address)":{"details":"Binds a mining address to the specified staking address. Called by the `StakingHbbft.addPool` function when a user wants to become a candidate and creates a pool. See also the `miningByStakingAddress` and `stakingByMiningAddress` public mappings.","params":{"_miningAddress":"The mining address of the newly created pool. Cannot be equal to the `_stakingAddress` and should never be used as a pool before.","_stakingAddress":"The staking address of the newly created pool. Cannot be equal to the `_miningAddress` and should never be used as a pool before."}}}},"userdoc":{"methods":{}}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"/home/sn/dmd/dmd-meta/hbbft-posdao-contracts/contracts/ValidatorSetHbbft.sol":"ValidatorSetHbbft"},"evmVersion":"istanbul","libraries":{},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"/home/sn/dmd/dmd-meta/hbbft-posdao-contracts/contracts/ValidatorSetHbbft.sol":{"keccak256":"0xd51b96f2e338ef2d50af3f33534203eea94e982b3ce75b66ce452562931916a5","urls":["bzz-raw://03b58a3352199967abfff88ddfe243c570bfd989abae02d879af8a542b182f1d","dweb:/ipfs/Qmco4qs4TvFMs544V6bhTdSCBytkaeD6griHrHLfLPnToA"]},"/home/sn/dmd/dmd-meta/hbbft-posdao-contracts/contracts/interfaces/IBlockRewardHbbft.sol":{"keccak256":"0x3c1584cfd166741f927feab7398d08979ffee78995c2fdf58f04434dd0f1ee5d","urls":["bzz-raw://09ba56a1e5f90cda6d3f15060639432a718380fdddc6f997f46b2b1a9c1e29a6","dweb:/ipfs/QmQfeLM6YjK9nUf2dWNrrsJsBiGPwhpqetjiN9yByYQH5w"]},"/home/sn/dmd/dmd-meta/hbbft-posdao-contracts/contracts/interfaces/IKeyGenHistory.sol":{"keccak256":"0x85b14e8a0c45a81decd44be9349400c046236e64eb0056e8941be9e02efab359","urls":["bzz-raw://fac059e6bc8b328896def98f484bcee4c21aea1f81325f521b2985c41f13e502","dweb:/ipfs/QmbQwDvePYVdYxSuJ2pTgQzrYiuXfvAfPnQnJfbXMhnxGQ"]},"/home/sn/dmd/dmd-meta/hbbft-posdao-contracts/contracts/interfaces/IRandomHbbft.sol":{"keccak256":"0xba5c1a7935bb398f241f4e9ab74c813ce020945ddbca2ae25c76588195d99428","urls":["bzz-raw://b1e5ed76dceb549cb41c0969c4ffae3213e452d53f8e457d68c9cafeb0abd20b","dweb:/ipfs/QmdUtpfrrm93RXiUP6oGDVz172dvUkrCCCRJMLymRAU9Fp"]},"/home/sn/dmd/dmd-meta/hbbft-posdao-contracts/contracts/interfaces/IStakingHbbft.sol":{"keccak256":"0x8df84e2ade170fa189527ed5c799f6881804ec45cafb7c24e68d8c67547bc43c","urls":["bzz-raw://b8f0d9b01261a77be9fe91d5a2f0dc0d15af9679e829e8afaf62400b481fc55d","dweb:/ipfs/QmUJ83vRQhvCM4Byim8bF4wbYEZqfXKfeXjQx8h7burUds"]},"/home/sn/dmd/dmd-meta/hbbft-posdao-contracts/contracts/interfaces/IValidatorSetHbbft.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf76b445b499a549a31b8aeb2d05475a17f53c8ed03 nodes.documentation:
@dev Stores the current validator set and contains the logic for choosing new validators
 before each staking epoch. The logic uses a random seed generated and stored by the `RandomHbbft` contract.
nodes.name: ValidatorSetHbbft
ReportedMalicious

nodes.documentation:
@dev Emitted by the `handleFailedKeyGeneration` function to signal that a specific validator was
 marked as unavailable since he dit not contribute to the required key shares.
nodes.name: ValidatorUnavailable

nodes.name: onlyInitialized

nodes.name: initialize

nodes.documentation:
@dev Called by the system when a pending validator set is ready to be activated.
 Only valid when msg.sender == SUPER_USER (EIP96, 2**160 - 2).
 After this function is called, the `getValidators` getter returns the new validator set.
 If this function finalizes a new validator set formed by the `newValidatorSet` function,
 an old validator set is also stored and can be read by the `getPreviousValidators` getter.
nodes.name: finalizeChange

nodes.documentation:
@dev Implements the logic which forms a new validator set. If the number of active pools
 is greater than MAX_VALIDATORS, the logic chooses the validators randomly using a random seed generated and
 stored by the `RandomHbbft` contract.
 Automatically called by the `BlockRewardHbbft.reward` function at the latest block of the staking epoch.
nodes.name: newValidatorSet
removeMaliciousValidators

nodes.documentation:
@dev called by validators when a validator comes online after
 getting marked as unavailable caused by a failed key generation.
nodes.name: announceAvailability

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "failed key generation can only be processed after the staking epoch is over."

arguments.value: failed key generation can only be processed after the staking epoch is over.

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the current validator set (an array of mining addresses)
 which always matches the validator set kept in validator's node.
nodes.name: getValidators

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns a boolean flag indicating if the `initialize` function has been called.
nodes.name: isInitialized

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified validator (mining address)
 is able to call the `reportMalicious` function or whether the specified validator (mining address)
 can be reported as malicious. This function also allows a validator to call the `reportMalicious`
 function several blocks after ceasing to be a validator. This is possible if a
 validator did not have the opportunity to call the `reportMalicious` function prior to the
 engine calling the `finalizeChange` function.
 @param _miningAddress The validator's mining address.

 Called by the `finalizeChange` function.

@dev Called by the system when a pending validator set is ready to be activated.
 Only valid when msg.sender == SUPER_USER (EIP96, 2**160 - 2).
 After this function is called, the `getValidators` getter returns the new validator set.
 If this function finalizes a new validator set formed by the `newValidatorSet` function,
 an old validator set is also stored and can be read by the `getPreviousValidators` getter.
nodes.name: finalizeChange

nodes.documentation:
@dev Implements the logic which forms a new validator set. If the number of active pools
 is greater than MAX_VALIDATORS, the logic chooses the validators randomly using a random seed generated and
 stored by the `RandomHbbft` contract.
 Automatically called by the `BlockRewardHbbft.reward` function at the latest block of the staking epoch.

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified validator (mining address)
 is able to call the `reportMalicious` function or whether the specified validator (mining address)
 can be reported as malicious. This function also allows a validator to call the `reportMalicious`
 function several blocks after ceasing to be a validator. This is possible if a
 validator did not have the opportunity to call the `reportMalicious` function prior to the
 engine calling the `finalizeChange` function.
 @param _miningAddress The validator's mining address.

 Used by the `_removeMaliciousValidator` internal function.

_getRandomIndex

devdoc.details: Stores the current validator set and contains the logic for choosing new validators before each staking epoch. The logic uses a random seed generated and stored by the `RandomHbbft` contract.

announceAvailability().details: called by validators when a validator comes online after getting marked as unavailable caused by a failed key generation.

areDelegatorsBanned(address).details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether delegators of the specified pool are currently banned. A validator pool can be banned when they misbehave (see the `_removeMaliciousValidator` function).

params._miningAddress: The mining address of the pool.

finalizeChange().details: Called by the system when a pending validator set is ready to be activated. Only valid when msg.sender == SUPER_USER (EIP96, 2**160 - 2). After this function is called, the `getValidators` getter returns the new validator set. If this function finalizes a new validator set formed by the `newValidatorSet` function, an old validator set is also stored and can be read by the `getPreviousValidators` getter.

getPendingValidators().details: Returns the current array of pending validators i.e. waiting to be activated in the new epoch The pending array is changed when a validator is removed as malicious or the validator set is updated by the `newValidatorSet` function.

getPreviousValidators().details: Returns the previous validator set (validators' mining addresses array). The array is stored by the `finalizeChange` function when a new staking epoch's validator set is finalized.

getValidators().details: Returns the current validator set (an array of mining addresses) which always matches the validator set kept in validator's node.

initialize(address,address,address,addre.details: Initializes the network parameters. Used by the constructor of the `InitializerHbbft` contract.

params._initialMiningAddresses: The array of initial validators' mining addresses.
params._initialStakingAddresses: The array of initial validators' staking addresses.

isInitialized().details: Returns a boolean flag indicating if the `initialize` function has been called.

isPendingValidator(address).details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified mining address is a pending validator. Used by the `isValidatorOrPending` and `KeyGenHistory.writeAck/Part` functions.

isReportValidatorValid(address).details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified validator (mining address) is able to call the `reportMalicious` function or whether the specified validator (mining address) can be reported as malicious. This function also allows a validator to call the `reportMalicious` function several blocks after ceasing to be a validator. This is possible if a validator did not have the opportunity to call the `reportMalicious` function prior to the engine calling the `finalizeChange` function.

isValidatorBanned(address).details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified mining address is currently banned. A validator can be banned when they misbehave (see the `_removeMaliciousValidator` internal function).

isValidatorOrPending(address).details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified mining address is a validator or is in the `_pendingValidators`. Used by the `StakingHbbft.maxWithdrawAllowed` and `StakingHbbft.maxWithdrawOrderAllowed` getters.

maliceReportedForBlock(address,uint256).details: Returns an array of the validators (their mining addresses) which reported that the specified malicious validator misbehaved at the specified block.

params._miningAddress: The mining address of malicious validator.

newValidatorSet().details: Implements the logic which forms a new validator set. If the number of active pools is greater than MAX_VALIDATORS, the logic chooses the validators randomly using a random seed generated and stored by the `RandomHbbft` contract. Automatically called by the `BlockRewardHbbft.reward` function at the latest block of the staking epoch.

removeMaliciousValidators(address[]).details: Removes malicious validators. Called by the the Hbbft engine when a validator has been inactive for a long period.

params._miningAddresses: The mining addresses of the malicious validators.

reportMalicious(address,uint256).details: Reports that the malicious validator misbehaved at the specified block. Called by the node of each honest validator after the specified validator misbehaved. See https://wiki.parity.io/Validator-Set.html#reporting-contract Can only be called when the `reportMaliciousCallable` getter returns `true`.

params._blockNumber: The block number where the misbehavior was observed.
params._maliciousMiningAddress: The mining address of the malicious validator.

reportMaliciousCallable(address,address,.details: Returns whether the `reportMalicious` function can be called by the specified validator with the given parameters. Used by the `reportMalicious` function and `TxPermission` contract. Also, returns a boolean flag indicating whether the reporting validator should be removed as malicious due to excessive reporting during the current staking epoch.

params._blockNumber: The block number which is passed to the `reportMalicious` function.
params._maliciousMiningAddress: The mining address of the malicious validator which is passed to the `reportMalicious` function.
params._reportingMiningAddress: The mining address of the reporting validator which is calling the `reportMalicious` function.

reportMaliciousCallable(address,address,.return: `bool callable` - The boolean flag indicating whether the `reportMalicious` function can be called at the moment. `bool removeReportingValidator` - The boolean flag indicating whether the reporting validator should be removed as malicious due to excessive reporting. This flag is only used by the `reportMalicious` function.

setStakingAddress(address,address).details: Binds a mining address to the specified staking address. Called by the `StakingHbbft.addPool` function when a user wants to become a candidate and creates a pool. See also the `miningByStakingAddress` and `stakingByMiningAddress` public mappings.

params._miningAddress: The mining address of the newly created pool. Cannot be equal to the `_stakingAddress` and should never be used as a pool before.
params._stakingAddress: The staking address of the newly created pool. Cannot be equal to the `_miningAddress` and should never be used as a pool before.
